text: Andrew Edward McKeever DSO, MC & Bar, DFC (21 August 1894 - 25 December 1919) was a Canadian World War I two-seater flying ace. He is thought to have won 31 battles. He was the highest scoring two seater fighter pilot in the Royal Flying Corps or Royal Air Force. ==References== Category:1894 births Category:1919 deaths Category:Military people from Ontario Category:Deaths from cerebral thrombosis Category:Military personnel of World War I
title: Andrew Edward McKeever
